page.title: 11OUR SCHOOL FAIR
page.content:
My name is Helena. I was the{Queen of {the fair.}The dress was very pretty, it had an underskirt and a cape. On Friday I had my hair curled. It felt strange. At school my 2 attendants held my cape. In the parade from the village centre was a penny farthing bicycle. It was at the front followed by decorated and noisy bicycles.I came next then the garland dancers. At the fair there were games to play, competitions with prizes, maypole dancing and refreshments. The money that was raised, over Â£500 will be used to buy things for us children at school.
By Paul Cross.Aged 9,Helena Jenkins Aged 11.
